authorsByline: Ken de la Bastide , The Herald Bulletin, Anderson, Ind.
title: More details emerge in fatal crash in Anderson
description: ANDERSON — A police report from the investigation of an Aug. 5 accident in Anderson that killed two men draws no conclusions on who was driving the stolen pickup truck. The report, written by Detective Nolan Schaefer with the Anderson Police Department, states the 2006 Ford F250 truck was stolen from Jonesboro on the night of the crash. content:
ANDERSON — A police report from the investigation of an Aug. 5 accident in Anderson that killed two men draws no conclusions on who was driving the stolen pickup truck.

The report, written by Detective Nolan Schaefer with the Anderson Police Department, states the 2006 Ford F250 truck was stolen from Jonesboro on the night of the crash.

The report states that Preston Jett, 20, and Landon Shaffer, 17, died as a result of the accident, which happened following a police chase from Alexandria. The third person in the truck was identified as Dalton Jett, 16.

Both Preston and Dalton Jett were thrown from the vehicle in the accident near the intersection of West 17th Street and Jackson Street.

“At this time, it is unclear which of the vehicle's three occupants were driving the vehicle at the time of the crash,” the report states.

The chase began after Alexandria police attempted to stop the pickup — on suspicion of drunken driving, criminal recklessness and reckless driving — about 2 a.m. near Washington Street and North Park Avenue in Alexandria.

Anderson police reported the pickup was southbound — the wrong direction on one-way northbound Jackson Street between Sixth and 17th streets — “at a high rate of speed” before it crashed into two buildings in the 1700 block.

The driver of the pickup lost control, police reported, and “the vehicle left the roadway, struck a utility pole and two houses, then came to rest inverted on the roadway.”

The chase ended about 12 miles from where it began in Alexandria.

“He’s going the wrong way on Jackson,” an officer said over the radio.

The officer apparently ceased his active pursuit about 2:15 a.m., but kept an eye on the speeding truck to see where it was going.

The vehicle struck a curb moments later near the intersection of Jackson and 17th streets and became airborne, striking the two buildings on the east side of the road.

Officers from the Anderson Police Department were called to the scene.

“We’re going to need several medics,” an officer said over the radio moments later.
summary: A police report from the investigation of an Aug. 5 accident in Anderson, which killed two men, has not yet disclosed who was driving the stolen Ford F250 truck. The accident, which occurred following a police chase from Alexandria, occurred near Washington Street and North Park Avenue in Alexandria at 2 a.m. The driver of the pickup lost control and it hit a utility pole and two houses before coming to rest inverted. Both Preston and Dalton Jett were ejected from the vehicle. The police chase began about 2:15 a., but ended about 12 miles from where it began.
shortSummary: A police report into a fatal pickup crash in Anderson reveals no definite driver, despite a police chase ending in a loss of consciousness.
argos_summary: A police report on the August 5 crash in Anderson, involving a stolen 2006 Ford F250, found no clear driver among its three occupants. The vehicle, pursued by Alexandria officers for suspected drunken and reckless driving, was traveling the wrong way at high speed, crashed into two buildings, and overturned, killing 20‑year‑old Preston Jett and 17‑year‑old Landon Shaffer while 16‑year‑old Dalton Jett survived the crash. The chase ended about 12 miles from its start, and investigators remain uncertain who was driving at the time of the collision.
